meanings.definition: A device used to measure distances or heights by means of the angles subtended at the eye of the observer.
meanings.sent1: The telemeter helped the explorer measure the height of the mountain accurately.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor used a telemeter to calculate the distance between the two buildings.
meanings.sent3: The telemeter made it easy for the hiker to know how far they had climbed.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes acted like a telemeter, gauging the distance between the trees effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The telemeter, like a magical eye, revealed the exact length of the river.

meanings.definition: To measure or determine the distance of with a telemeter.
meanings.sent1: He will telemeter the distance between the islands using advanced technology.
meanings.sent2: The scientist telemetered the depth of the ocean with precision.
meanings.sent3: She decided to telemeter the length of the hallway for fun.
meanings.sent4: The satellite telemetered data back to Earth from the far reaches of space.
meanings.sent5: Telemetering the height of the skyscraper was a challenging task for the engineer.
